content.2: Unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called
content.4: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
content.5: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and
content.6: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:
content.7: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:
content.8: Who shall also confirm you unto the end,
content.10: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and
content.11: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by them
content.12: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.
content.13: Is Christ divided? was Paul crucified for you? or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?
content.14: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;
content.15: Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.
content.16: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.
content.17: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.
content.18: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.
content.19: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.
content.21: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.
content.22: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:
content.23: But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;
content.24: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.
content.25: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
content.26: For ye see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble,
content.27: But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;
content.28: And base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen,
content.29: That no flesh should glory in his presence.
content.30: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:
content.31: That, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
